intro: Ophiorrhiza marchandii, commonly known as the Malabar mallow, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of India and Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky habitats. Its roots are often fibrous and can form dense mats, contributing to soil stabilization. Ophiorrhiza marchandii is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, making it an important component of tropical ecosystems.
